SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.rmi

Interface RmiServerInterface

All Superinterfaces:
Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
RmiServer
public interface RmiServerInterface extends Remote
The RmiServerInterface defines methods for interacting with a remote game server using RMI. This interface includes various operations related to managing and participating in a game, such as drawing and placing cards, creating and joining games, choosing starting objectives, posting chat messages, and verifying player credentials.

The interface extends the Remote class, which means that all of its methods can be invoked by remote clients via RMI. As a result, each method throws a RemoteException in case of communication errors or other issues related to RMI.

  • Method Details

    • drawCard

      Integer drawCard(UUID game, String player, Integer position) throws RemoteException
      Make the given player in the game with the provided UUID draw a card based on the position: 0-3: visible cards 4: stdCard 5: goldCard
      Parameters:
      game - the id of the game
      player - the name of the player
      position - the position of the card
      Returns:
      the id of the drawn card
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI error occurs.
      See Also:
      • SharedBoard.draw(Integer)

    • placeCard

      Boolean placeCard(UUID game, String player, Coordinates coordinates, Integer cardID) throws RemoteException
      Place a card from the players hand at the given coordinates
      Parameters:
      game - the id of the game
      player - the name of the player
      coordinates - the coordinates where to place the card
      cardID - the id of the placed card
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI error occurs.

    • newGame

      UUID newGame(Integer player_count, String gameName) throws RemoteException
      Create a new game with the given capacity, returning the game uuid
      Parameters:
      player_count - the number of players
      Returns:
      the uuid of the game if the operation was successful, null otherwise
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI error occurs.

      boolean join(UUID game, String name) throws RemoteException
      Allows a player to join an existing game.
      Parameters:
      game - The UUID of the game.
      name - The name of the player joining the game.
      Returns:
      True if the player successfully joins the game, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI error occurs.

      game - The UUID of the game.
      name - The name of the player.
      Returns:

      boolean checkCredentials(String username, String password) throws RemoteException
      Check whether the given credentials are valid (size less than 16 and username is not reused)
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      password - the password of the player
      Returns:
      true if the given credentials are valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI error occurs.
